snippet.title: 2  Why Every Team Needs a Shared Definition of Done
snippet.description:
🎯 Why Every Team Needs a Shared Definition of Done
🎥 Episode 2 of 10 — Now Streaming

🎲 Without shared standards, quality is a coin toss.
One team says “done” means tested.
Another thinks it means deployed.
A third? Just code complete.

💥 The result?
→ Chaos.
→ Production risks.
→ Invisible liabilities that show up after release.

If every team defines "done" differently,
you’re not building value—you’re building uncertainty.

At NKD Agility, we help organizations align on a single, clear Definition of Done—
🛠️ A standard everyone understands
✅ A standard everyone honors
📦 A standard that ensures every increment is usable, validated, and trustworthy
Because predictability doesn’t come from fragmented processes.
It comes from alignment.
📈 If you're tired of surprises, rework, and blame games—this is the shift you need. Visit https://www.nkdagility.com

👇 Watch now. Follow for the full 10-part series.
#DefinitionOfDone #AgileQuality #EngineeringExcellence #DevOps #PredictableDelivery #NKDAgility #MartinHinshelwood #SoftwareCraftsmanship #RedefiningDone #TeamAlignment
